bullets: Vicente Amorim is attached to direct Netflix Brazil’s film adaptation of Paulo Coelho’s semi-autobiographical novel The Pilgrimage, reuniting Amorim with Netflix and Gullane after directing Senna.
Amorim said he met with Paulo Coelho in Geneva to discuss the film adaptation, which was first announced last year.
Netflix Brazil unveiled a new film written and adapted by crime writer Raphael Montes titled A Estranha na Cama, which Montes is adapting from his own upcoming novel.

Netflix Brazil announced five new titles at the Born in Brazil showcase, including series from Carolina Duro and the creative team of Claudio Pavia and Maurício Farias, plus a scripted reality show hosted by Claudia Raia.

Netflix presented Rauls, a new series from KondZilla and LB Entertainment focused on cyber scams among young people set in poor urban outskirts, with overall direction by Kaique Alves and production by Manas Filmes.
Rauls was described as distinct from the Sintonia franchise despite sharing the same setting, and its screenplay credits include Thiago Dottori, Raul Perez, Donna Oliveira, and Teodoro Poppovic.
Netflix previewed Habeas Corpus, a courtroom drama inspired by the Innocence Project Brasil starring Marjorie Estiano and Any Gabrielly, directed by Luiz Villaça and produced by Caf Royal.
Netflix framed the Born in Brazil presentation as both a slate reveal and a celebration of its deepening relationships with Brazil’s creative community and the country’s expanding global reach.
Variety counted at least 17 Brazilian titles that entered Netflix’s Global Top 10 since June 2025, underscoring a notable increase in Netflix Brazilian global hits in 2025.
Netflix executives emphasized a strategic push into Brazilian movies in 2025, noting the platform licensed 55 Brazilian films to honor local culture and to help projects become financially viable.
